thread.title: Heatwave: Season’s First 40°c Day | Ahmedabad News - Times of India
thread.title_full: Heatwave: Season’s First 40°c Day | Ahmedabad News - Times of India

author: TNN
title: Heatwave: Season’s First 40°c Day | Ahmedabad News - Times of India
text: Ahmedabad: Due to a heatwave on Thursday, the mercury touched 40°C in Amreli and Rajkot for the first time this season. Ahmedabad recorded a maximum temperature of 37.4°C, 0.7 degrees higher than normal. The minimum temperature at 22°C was 1.6 degrees higher than normal.According to the India Meteorological Department (IMD) forecast, minimum and maximum temperatures will likely stay around 38°C and 22°C on Friday. “No large change during the next five days is very likely,” mentioned the forecast.At 40.2°C, Amreli recorded the highest maximum temperature, followed by 40.1°C in Rajkot and 39.4°C in Keshod. Parts of north Gujarat reported cloudy weather. tnnWe also published the following articles recentlyDelhi records minimum temperature of 10.1 degree Celsius, IMD predicts partly cloudy sky todayDelhi experienced a chilly morning with 10.1C min temp and 30C max. Humidity at 70%, AQI 147 'moderate'. Ranges: 0-50 'good', 51-100 'satisfactory'. Cloudy skies, pollution levels categorized.Delhi records minimum temperature of 11.9 degree Celsius, IMD predicts cloudy skies todayDelhi's morning chill at 11.9C below usual, cloudy skies, 67% humidity. AQI 'moderate' at 185. Sunday, 8:30 am recorded.Winter temperature trends in India hint at shorter spring, study showsClimate Central study reveals India's winter temperature surge, impacting spring duration. Urgent actions needed to combat climate change effects on ecosystems and livelihoods.
